text.0:
ITV changed a story after initially claiming Rishi Sunak suggested people working in the arts should retrain and find other jobs.

But what did the Chancellor actually say? We've transcribed the interview so you can judge for yourself.

https://t.co/N09Qe5Xk92
text.1: "An absence of trustworthy information from official sources provides the perfect environment for rumours to flourish" @FullFact Editor Tom Phillips on the absence of good information in the Trump-Covid saga, for @theipaper @ipaperviews @flashboy  https://t.co/241X6WFPmg
text.2:
Add our new Whatsapp number to your contacts ▼

You can forward us any claims you get sent - whether it's text, image, video or voice note.

text.3:
Deep Fakes have often been touted as an emerging tool of disinformation, but how significant is the problem now, and how bad might it get?

We discuss the fast-developing technology on The Full Fact Podcast with experts Dr Hany Farid and @AreeqChowdhury.

https://t.co/bKoAtYcfPk
text.4:
In a previous version of this tweet, we said that one of the government's targets appeared "unlikely to be met." We have now changed this, as it is actually impossible to check.

We used wording from an earlier draft of the article.

For transparency, here is the original tweet: https://t.co/pkPGnjp13v
text.5:
Two more of the government’s testing deadlines have passed.

It looks like one of them was met before it was announced. The other is currently impossible to check.

https://t.co/hfCdY6nR63
